alert.note: Alert for Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:54PM EDT until May 21 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR WESTERN SENECA...NORTHWESTERN WYANDOT AND SOUTHEASTERN HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 454 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tiffin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Fostoria, Forest, Vanlue, New Riegel, Carey, Mount Blanchard, Wharton and Bascom. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
